Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw two different habitats, one on land and one in water, with general clarity and distinction between the two.
The student can include various types of living things in each habitat, such as trees and animals like squirrels in the land habitat, and fish in the water habitat.
The student can generally label or visually distinguish the different types of plants and animals in each habitat, though some labels may be incomplete or missing.
The student can depict how certain plants and animals are suited to their habitat, such as fish in water or squirrels in trees, showing a basic understanding of ecological adaptation.
CANNOT: The student may not consistently illustrate detailed patterns of biodiversity, such as smaller or less noticeable organisms, potentially overlooking some species diversity.

The student may have minor inaccuracies or gaps in labeling, such as calling a specific type of fish by a more general name (e.g., 'fish' instead of 'trout') or missing labels entirely on a few components.
